newsitem.title: UK: Japanese stocks in London steady, trade thin.
newsitem.headline: Japanese stocks in London steady, trade thin.

text.p: Japanese shares were little changed from Tokyo's close on Tuesday with many investors still absent after the four-day Easter holiday break, dealers said.
"A lot of people are still on holiday. We've seen very little business going through. It's been a day to catch up on paperwork," one dealer said.

In Tokyo on Tuesday, stocks ended moderately lower on the first day of the 1997/98 financial year. Wall Street's woes and renewed worries about Japan's financial system pushed the Nikkei-225 index 133.81 points lower to 17,869.59.
Only a handful of shares had traded by 1420 GMT. Hitachi was standing at 1,092.5 yen in London after a Tokyo close of 1,100 yen. Fujitsu slipped to 1,250 yen after a Tokyo finish of 1,260 yen.
